item.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description:
ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. What started as a tool to hyper-charge productivity through writing essays and code with short text prompts has evolved into a behemoth used by more than 92% of Fortune 500 companies. That growth has propelled OpenAI itself into […]

item.title: Caroline Ellison sentenced to two years in prison for FTX fraud
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Caroline Ellison, the former CEO of FTX affiliate Alameda Research, was sentenced to two years in prison on Tuesday. Ellison had pled guilty to conspiring with FTX’s Sam Bankman-Fried to steal $8 billion worth of customers’ funds, but she was an exceedingly cooperative witness, helping law enforcement to investigate the massive fraud scheme. Her two-year […]

item.title: Commvault acquires data backup provider Clumio
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
The deal is expected to close in early October. Commvault says it's not material to its earnings and that it'll be funded with cash on hand.

item.title: The best Twitter alternatives worth checking out
item.dc:creator: Taylor Hatmaker, Aisha Malik
item.description:
We’ll be straight with you. There’s no 1:1 Twitter replacement, but there are plenty of social apps that might be worth substituting into your obsessive timeline-checking routines if you’re done with Twitter for whatever reason (we can think of plenty). Twitter’s current situation — advertisers leaving, Nazis logging back on — presents an opportunity to […]

item.title: EGYM, a connected fitness startup conceived after the founder hit a wall at the gym, lands $200M at a $1.2B+ valuation
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Getting healthy is big business these days. Now a startup that’s come up with a unique approach leveraging tech to help people with their exercise regimes is announcing a big round of funding, putting some weight behind its own push for growth.  Munich-based EGYM — a maker of connected fitness equipment and personalized training tech […]

The Rodecaster Video is up for preorder starting today. It ships October 10.

item.title: Northvolt lays off 1,600 workers, but it’s not the end for Europe’s battery champion
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
Europe’s attempt at building a battery manufacturing powerhouse announced that it had halted work on a factory expansion and laid off about 20% of its employees.

item.title: OpenAI rolls out Advanced Voice Mode with more voices and a new look
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
OpenAI announced it is rolling out Advanced Voice Mode (AVM) to an expanded set of ChatGPT’s paying customers on Tuesday. The audio feature, which makes ChatGPT more natural to speak with, will initially roll out to customers in ChatGPT’s Plus and Teams tiers. Enterprise and Edu customers will start receiving access next week. As part […]

item.title: Nothing launches a slick pair of $149 open-ear headphones
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
The Nothing Ear Open costs $149 and will ship starting October 1.

item.title: Toyota Ventures’ Jim Adler says climate tech startups need to secure future buyers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Jim Adler, founder and general partner at Toyota Ventures, is concerned that climate technology gains could fall into the “valley of death” if companies fail to drum up enough demand to survive.  And he’s not wrong to be worried.  Climate tech investments in the first half of 2024 dipped for the second consecutive year, both […]

item.title: From dinners with Travis Kalanick to fired after maternity leave: One of CloudKitchens’ earliest employees is suing
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis, Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Isabella Vincenza, one of CloudKitchens’ earliest employees, never imagined she would be suing her now-former employer. Hired as a full-time salesperson in 2018, she became a mainstay at President’s Club dinners hosted by CEO Travis Kalanick at his Bel Air home throughout 2020 and 2021. These dinners were prized, invite-only events for top salespeople at […]

item.title: Rivian reveals first $10M in grants for long-promised Rivian Foundation
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Rivian has revealed the first $10 million worth of grants from the Rivian Foundation, three years after the EV maker vowed the philanthropy would receive 1% of its equity to make the “natural world” a “stakeholder in our success.” The company launched Monday a website for the foundation that details 41 grantees who will collectively […]

item.title: Moxie, which helps nurses launch medspas, raises a preemptive Series B from Lachy Groom
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Moxie helps nurses open medspas by providing them with most of the tools they need to run their businesses, from billing software and marketing services to discounted supplies. The startup has raised a $10 million Series B led by existing investor Lachy Groom, a solo VC, with participation from SignalFire. The round comes only a […]

item.description:
If your startup is only remotely related to working with data pipelines, you’re probably trying to figure out how to capitalize on the current moment: Enterprises are trying to figure out how to best use data to power generative AI products, and to do that, they need robust data services. Time is running out to grab savings of up to $600 on individual tickets for TechCrunch Disrupt 2024! item.title: Tech YouTuber MKBHD’s Panels app is a bit underwhelming
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Tech YouTuber Marques Brownlee, or MKBHD, is stepping out of the reviewer role and into the mindset of a builder. This week, he launched a wallpaper app called Panels on iOS and Android, where he’s personally curating high-quality digital wallpapers from artists — but of course, there’s a catch. In order to access high-resolution wallpapers […]

item.title: As the open social web grows, a new nonprofit looks to expand the ‘fediverse’
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
A new project launching today aims to capitalize on the momentum seen within the fediverse, also known as the open social web, which describes interconnected social networking services powered by the ActivityPub protocol. Co-founded by the co-author and current editor of ActivityPub, Evan Prodromou, a new nonprofit organization called the Social Web Foundation will focus […]

item.title: A startup from ex-Revolut employees uses AI to automate accounts — but hopes to keep accountants in jobs
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
Successful startups can give rise to “startup mafias” — groups of former founders who go on to create other startups. But at least as often, new startups can be founded by employees. In the case of LiveFlow, that’s exactly what happened — and it has now raised $13.5 million. A few years ago, Anita Koimur […]

item.title: Microsoft claims its new tool can correct AI hallucinations, but experts advise caution
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Microsoft today revealed Correction, a service that attempts to automatically revise AI-generated text that's factually wrong.
